cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 miles SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coastline, then expected to slow and meander inland across the Carolinas and eventually weaken over the southeastern United States

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Tropical Storm Watch north of NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North Carolina and northern South Carolina coast with impacts extending into southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late in the 5-day period but sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for light to moderate remnant rainfall early next week as the weakening system or its moisture passes south of Michigan
